data.description:
## Goal (WHY)
Every WovenMind output should include "how sure are we?" information.

## Interface Contract (WHAT)
```python
@dataclass
class WovenMindResult:
    mode: ThinkingMode
    activations: Set[str]
    surprise: Optional[float]
    predictions: Dict[str, float]
    source: str
    metadata: Dict[str, Any]
    confidence: float  # NEW: 0.0-1.0 confidence in this result
    confidence_factors: Dict[str, float]  # NEW: breakdown of confidence sources
```

## Integration Points
- Modifies: cortical/reasoning/woven_mind.py (WovenMindResult dataclass)
- Affects: WovenMind.process() must compute and set confidence

## Test Requirements
Location: tests/unit/test_woven_mind.py (add to existing)

```python
def test_result_has_confidence():
    mind = WovenMind()
    mind.train("neural networks")
    result = mind.process(["neural"])
    assert hasattr(result, 'confidence')
    assert 0.0 <= result.confidence <= 1.0

def test_confidence_factors_present():
    result = mind.process(["neural"])
    assert 'confidence_factors' in dir(result)
    assert isinstance(result.confidence_factors, dict)

def test_familiar_input_higher_confidence():
    mind = WovenMind()
    mind.train("familiar pattern")
    familiar = mind.process(["familiar"])
    novel = mind.process(["completely_unknown_xyz"])
    assert familiar.confidence > novel.confidence
```

Verification: python -m pytest tests/unit/test_woven_mind.py -v -k "confidence"

## Anti-Patterns
- Do NOT break existing WovenMindResult usage
- Do NOT change serialization without updating to_dict/from_dict
- Do NOT make confidence computation expensive

## Freedom Zone
- How confidence is computed (surprise-based, prediction-based, hybrid)
- What factors to include in confidence_factors
- Default confidence for edge cases

## Reference: docs/woven-mind-user-guide.md
data.title: Add confidence field to WovenMindResult
